title: Drawing, Harold S. Anderson House: Serving Cabinet, March 8, 1937
title_raw: Harold S. Anderson House: Serving Cabinet
medium: Graphite, red, and blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 8564/F.S.D./ANDERSON, OLSSON/P.S./D./ 3.8.37, 3/13/37, 1, MASTERCR./ 4/8/37, 1, GREENPOINT; above stamp in graphite: SERVING CABINET 48" x 18" x 34 1/2" H./BLEACHED WHITE HOLLY - FINISH ALL AROUND/INTERIOR WHITE HOLLY OR BLEACHED SYCAMORE/POL. CHROM. LEGS ON CASTORS WITH BRAKES/TUFLEX TOP/TWO DOORS - ADJUST. SHELF BEHIND/THREE DRAWERS - STOPPERS/DRAWERS & DOORS TO HAVE BULLET CATCHES/DRAWERS ON CENTRE GUIDES/TOP DRAWER WITH DIVISIONS FOR SILVER-/VELVET LINED- COLOR TO BE DECIDED/INSERTED PULLS - SOLID HOLLY/VENEER DOOR EDGES - TOP EDGES OF DRAWERS/AND ALL EXPOSED EDGES/DIMENSIONS FOR HOLES IN GLASS TOP DETERMINES EXACT/LOCATION OF LEGS AND THEREFOR MUST BE HELD/WAIT FOR GLASS TOP BEFORE BORING HOLES FOR LEGS; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for serving cabinet for Anderson house. Rectangular base of cabinet with Tuflex glass surface, raised above base. Three stacked drawers at center with divisions in drawers for silver; to be lined in velvet. Two cabinet doors at far left and right. Four low legs on casters.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Harold S. Anderson House: Serving Cabinet, March 8, 1937. Graphite, red, and blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper. 
Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-964
